top_comments_top.body:
Hello and welcome to r/LifeProTips!

Please help us decide if this post is a good fit for the subreddit by up or downvoting this comment. 

If you think that this is great advice to improve your life, please upvote. If you think this doesn't help you in any way, please downvote. If you don't care, leave it for the others to decide.

At one place I was a manager we were forbidden from calling associates unless we clocked them in.

"Hey Jay, sorry to bug you, just so you know your being compensated right now... Do you remember where you put the Jenkins file? Okay, thanks talk to you later" 15min paid OT if applicable

I often use the delay delivery feature if I'm sending email outside usual hours or to people on leave. That way, even the ones who can't stop themselves working during down time don't have the temptation. 
I tell them I do this, so when the need arises to send tasks/info outside of usual hours, they know I think it's important.
I think that the EU are going to pass a law about this. Perhaps it’s not going ahead but it’s becoming more and more annoying and acceptable for bosses or colleagues to contact outside working hours.

Eh. Depends on what you do for a living and a lot on how reasonable the request is. I’m salaried and support systems that need to run 24/7.  I’d rather get a phone call about a problem on a Friday night than come in on Monday to a much bigger problem.

If your boss was hounding you about petty day to day stuff that could just as reasonably be addressed the next working day, I can see that being pretty annoying.
